TopicTitle: Check if a part is on the active vessel?

Articles.Content:
I know you can use FlightGlobals.ActiveVesssel to check if a PartModule is part of the active vessel but what about MonoBehavours?

I am checking through some part objects and see if each one is part of the active ship?

Compare the part vessel reference to the vessel reference in flight globals ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

    part.Vessel == FlightGlobals.ActiveVessel

> 
> Compare the part vessel reference to the vessel reference in flight globals ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
>     part.Vessel == FlightGlobals.ActiveVessel

Unfortunately I couldn't do this because I was checking gameobjects instead of parts. (there was probably still a way)

I have now fixed it by instead of getting a bunch of gameobjects and checking if they are part of the active vessel, I am just loading parts from the vessel with

foreach (Part shipPart in FlightGlobals.ActiveVessel.parts)

Thanks anyway
